data: Was this then the conclusion of all things—that there was nothing so perfect that it was worth a man’s while to struggle for it; that any officious interference with the recognised and existing was a mistake; that nothing was either the best or the worst, but all things mere degrees in a round of the comparative, in which a little more or a little less was of no importance, and the most strenuous efforts tended to failure as much as indifference?
browsing: culture/civilization/society|browsing: literature|browsing: science-fiction & fantasy|browsing: fiction|category: novels|category: british literature
